definition: Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
(classical) a type of battle-ax/to kill/to slaughter
surname Liu
variant of 備|备[bei4]
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: Liu Bei lost no time in telling his brothers the story of King Wen bent on visiting one of his subjects called Jiang Ziya.
sentences.chinese: 刘备忙讲了当年文王访姜子牙的故事。

sentences.english: The victory opened the period of great prosperity for Liubei.
sentences.chinese: 汉中争夺战的胜利，开启了刘备事业的鼎盛时期。

sentences.english: "I will go, " said Liu Bei as soon as he heard the news.
sentences.chinese: “我要走了，”说刘备他一听到这个消息。

sentences.english: Liu Bei retired calmly, but Zhang Fei was furious.
sentences.chinese: 刘备退休的很平静，但张飞怒不可遏。

sentences.english: He had to make three visits before Zhuge Liang agreed to do so, impressed by his sincerity.
sentences.chinese: 诸葛亮见刘备十分诚恳，终于答应了他的请求。

sentences.english: Despite being greatly outnumbered, Liu Bei and Sun Quan eventually won the battle.
sentences.chinese: 尽管兵力悬殊，刘备和孙权最后还是打赢了这场战役。

sentences.english: Wu and Liu Bei's allied forces win in this way.
sentences.chinese: 东吴和刘备的联军就这样胜利了。

sentences.english: One was Liu Bei, a descendent of Liu Sheng, Prince Jin of Zhongshan during the Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 刘备，是汉朝中山靖王刘胜的后代。

sentences.english: Hastily dismounting, Liu Bei asked what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 匆忙下马，刘备问发生了什么事。

sentences.english: I think he made more of a contribution to history than Liu Bei did.
sentences.chinese: 我认为曹操对历史的贡献比刘备要多。

sentences.english: I don't like Liu Bei and friends.
Zhao Yun and Liu Bei's special relationship allowed him to do things others did not dare to do.
sentences.chinese: 赵云和刘备的特殊关系，使他敢做别人不敢做的事。

sentences.english: Then Liu Bei told them of the plan to strive for tranquillity.
sentences.chinese: 然后刘备告诉他们的计画，以争取平静。

sentences.english: First of all, as a fierce and ambitious generation of Liu Bei, does not have military talent.
sentences.chinese: 首先，作为一代枭雄的刘备，并不具有军事上的才华。

sentences.english: Liu Biao's wife Cai and her brother had long wished to Xiangyang to meet some officials.
sentences.chinese: 刘表的夫人蔡氏和其兄蔡瑁早有杀害刘备之心。

sentences.english: So Lü invited both Liu Bei and Ji Ling to a bqnqet.
sentences.chinese: 于是，吕布让人把刘备和纪灵同时请来赴宴。

definition: Cao Cao (155-220), famous statesman and general at the end of Han, noted poet and calligrapher, later warlord, founder and first king of Cao Wei 曹魏, father of Emperor Cao Pi 曹丕/the main villain of novel the Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义
Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period

Zhuge Liang (181-234), military leader and prime minister of Shu Han 蜀漢|蜀汉 during the Three Kingdoms period/the main hero of the fictional Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义, where he is portrayed as a sage and military genius/mastermind
Liu Biao (142-208), warlord
Zhou Yu or Chou Yü (175-210), famous general of the southern Wu kingdom and victor of the battle of Redcliff/in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, absolutely no match for Zhuge Liang

Guan Yu (-219), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, fearsome fighter famous for virtue and loyalty/posthumously worshipped and identified with the guardian Bodhisattva Sangharama
Sun Ce (175-200), general and major warlord of the Later Han Dynasty
Lü Bu (-198), general and warlord
Yuan Shao (153-202), general during late Han, subsequently warlord
Zhao Yun (-229), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
Lü Meng (178-219), general of the southern state of Wu
Eastern Wu (222-280)/the southern state of Wu during the Three Kingdoms period, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权
Shu Han (c. 200-263), Liu Bei's kingdom in Sichuan during the Three Kingdoms, claiming legitimacy as successor of Han
Ma Chao (176-222), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
Lu Su or Lu Zijing 魯子敬|鲁子敬 (172-217), statesman, diplomat and strategist of Eastern Wu 東吳|东吴
Liu Chan 劉禪|刘禅 (207-271), son of Liu Bei, reigned as Shu Han emperor 233-263
